You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show Company Information Fields on the Site Register Page

Provide controls for a buyer to specify company information when self-registering on your storefront. B2B Commerce for Visualforce automatically creates an account and user record for the buyer based on the information they specify during registration.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can configure the following fields:

Show the entire Additional Information section (1), which contains all company information fields. If you hide this section, a buyer can't enter any account information during registration.
Specify which value is selected by default in the Company Type picklist (2). When a buyer completes registration, B2B Commerce for Visualforce sets this value for the Company Type field on the buyer's user record.
NOTE The only supported values for this picklist are ISP, Security, and Data Management.
Show one or two custom, free-text fields (3), which map to custom fields on the buyer's account record.

To show company fields on the Site Register page, update your storefront configuration settings.

TIP To configure all available fields, you set configurations in two different modules.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Registration (3).
Find the Show Additional Info configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Registration
Configuration	Show Additional Info
Page	all
Value	TRUE
If you enabled Show Additional Info, find the Default Company Type configuration (6) and find its value (7).
TIP
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Registration
Configuration	Default Company Type
Page	all
Value	

Enter one of the following supported default values:

ISP
Security
Data Management
If you enabled Show Additional Info, specify whether to show one or both of the custom, free-text fields.
From the Module picklist, select User Profile (Registration) (8).
Find the Show Custom Field 1 (9) and Show Custom Field 2 (11) configurations, and find their values (10, 12).
TIP
If the custom field you want to show is TRUE, the field already appears on the Site Register page. Skip this step.
If the custom field you want to show is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	User Profile (Registration)
Configuration	Show Custom Field 1 or Show Custom Field 2
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
SEE ALSO
Account, Contact, and User Information for B2B Commerce for Visualforce Buyers

title: Configuring Company Information Fields on the Site Register Page
